column4: I am trying to use handbrake on 10.04 to rip my movies to view on my iphone It will scan the dvd but then will not let me rip I have the libdvdcss in place any idea what else I need to do?
have you ever watched dvd's on your computer?
or does viewing the dvd normally work at all?
- yes in the videoplayer they work fine, just not in handbrake
try copying the vob's to disc then and then encoding them
sorry I'm new to all this, whats the vob
the video files that are on the dvd
any particular program I should try that with or just ctl C ctl V
I tried saving the vob files, but it wouldn't let me, any other ideas?
but you can watch the video vob files when you open them in totem?
I don't have totem, I'll download it and brb
its installed by default on ubuntu
I can't get the copies to play
so you cant play dvd's on your computer?
i should say view video dvd's
I can play a dvd, but If I copy the files to the desktop, it won't let me play them, and I can not get them to play at all in handbrake
ah right, you need to rip the files from dvd
and i have the libdvdcss file
which may or may not be legal in your country, but anyway dvdrip, google gave me this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DVD%3A%3ARip which seems a bit dated
I'm not trying to do anything illegal, I just want to watch my movies I own on my iphone
im not saying you were, but i dont know much about ripping the video from dvd really, dvdrip ubuntu is just what i punched in on google
no worries I appreciate all the help :) thanks!!
